refsect1.title: Preliminaries
refsect1.para: Thought the only way to check your email on a wireless phone was via Yahoo.com? This demo will illustrate how a few VSP scripts on a Virtuoso server can provide a fully-functional wireless E-mail solution. Read messages from your POP-based email account from any WAP-enabled wireless device, or from the wireless phone emulators.

refsect1.title: Running the Demo on a WAP device
refsect1.para: To access this application via WAP/WML, enter the following URL into a WAP-enabled wireless device:

itemizedlist.listitem: index.vap - Main page that calls the other files.
signup.vsp - Code to register details about a new user.
login.vsp - Code to sign-in a registered user.
checkmail.vsp - Code to communicate with the POP3 account.

refsect1.title: Running the Demo on a WAP emulator
refsect1.para: To simulate viewing the output on a wireless device. Run the RunWapEmail.html file. Then choose a web-based emulator from one below:

itemizedlist.listitem: Wap.com - This is the most accurate Java and web based emulator, almost to the point of the definitive WAP SDK emulators from Openwave. However, its performance is not always optimal.
Wapsilon.com - This is a reasonably accurate emulator, but the user interface handling is not quite the same as a real WAP phone.
Wapmore.com - This is a PDA style emulator. Although its interface is a bit quirky, the performance is reasonable.
Gelon.net - This is probably the fastest web-based WAP emulator; however, it sometimes exhibits problems displaying WML forms.
Download WAP SDK - Our recommended option, this standard WAP SDK for emulators from Openwave.com (formerly Phone.com).
